Defines the size of the Fast Fourier Transform buffer. Trades accuracy for speed.
Toggle to show or hide the raw audio input graph.
Toggle to show or hide the FFT graph.
Toggle to show or hide the frequency graph.
Choose a low-pass filter to determine how the audio tapers off higher frequency noises and harmonics.
Choose a sample rate at which the raw audio is sampled. The only sample rate that is verified to work on all devices is 8000Hz.
Choose a center pitch to be the pitch standard for tuning.
Choose the amount of passes through the low-pass filter. The more passes, the more attenuation occurs in the upper frequencies.

Author: Adam Eichelkraut
 Date Updated: 4/24/14
 
Description
 This app leans more on the side of a 'frequency analyzer' rather than a full-blown tuner. The reasoning for this is because of the difficulties in pitch-detection. Pitch-detection requires much more than simply finding the frequency via the Fast Fourier Transform, although, we can get close by hacking some filters in to filter out the higher harmonics.
